meanings.sent1: She reinsures her car every year to make sure it stays protected.
meanings.sent2: The company reinsures their property to safeguard against unexpected events.
meanings.sent3: John joked that he should reinsure his phone in case it decides to go for a swim.
meanings.sent4: Reinsuring your health is like adding an extra layer of protection to your well-being.
meanings.sent5: Reinsuring your belongings can bring peace of mind during uncertain times.

meanings.definition: To provide insurance for a risk that has already been insured by another insurer.
meanings.sent1: The new company reinsures the policy to share the risk with the original insurer.
meanings.sent2: Insurance companies often reinsure policies to manage their exposure to large claims.
meanings.sent3: Sarah found it amusing that her insurance was reinsured by a company she had never heard of.
meanings.sent4: Reinsuring a policy is like having a safety net for the safety net.
meanings.sent5: Reinsuring a risk can help spread the financial burden across multiple insurers.
